revised_title: Gorgonopsid Skull Morphology and Evolutionary Relationships
tldr: The author examines the functional morphology of the gorgonopsid skull, focusing on a new species, Leontocephalus intactus. They discuss aspects of the dentition, jaw mechanism, and braincase, and propose a reconstruction of the brain. The study concludes that gorgonopsids had a distinct functional organization compared to the Therocephalia and were likely derived separately from sphenocondont pelycosaurs.
